metadata.titleEn: Glacier coverage data  on the Tibetan Plateau  in 1970s (TPG1976, Version 1.0)
metadata.description: The Tibetan Plateau Glacial Data -TPG1976 is a glacial coverage data on the Tibetan Plateau in the 1970s. It was generated by manual interpretation from Landsat MSS multispectral image data. The temporal coverage was mainly from 1972 to 1979 by 60 m spatial resolution. It involved 205 scenes of Landsat MSS/TM. There were 189 scenes（92% coverage on TP）in 1972-79，including 116 scenes in 1976/77 (61% of all the collected satellite data).As high quality of MSS data is not accessible due to cloud and snow effects in the South-east Tibetan Plateau, earlier Landsat TM data was collected for usage, including 14 scenes of 1980s（1981,1986-89,which covers 6.5% of TP） and 2 scenes in 1994（by 1.5% coverage on TP）.Among all satellite data，77% was collected in winter with the minimum effects of cloud and seasonal snow. The most frequent year in this period was defined as the reference year for the mosaic image: i.e. 1976. Glacier outlines were digitized on-screen manually from the 1976 image mosaic, relying on false-colour image composites (MSS: red, green and blue (RGB) represented by bands 321; TM: RGB by bands 543), which allowed us to distinguish ice/snow from cloud. Debris-free ice was distinguished from the debris and debris-covered ice by its higher reflectance. Debris-covered ice was not delineated in this data. The delineated glacier outlines were compared with band-ratio results, and validated by overlapping them onto Google Earth imagery, SRTM DEM, topographic maps and corresponding satellite images. For areas with mountain shadows and snow cover, they were verified by different methods using data from different seasons. For glaciers in deep shadow, Google EarthTM imagery from different dates was used as the reference for manual delineation. Steep slopes or headwalls were also excluded in the TPG1976. Areas that appeared in any of these sources to have the characteristics of exposed ground/basement/bed rock were manually delineated as non-glacier, and were also cross-checked with CGI-1 and CGI-2. Steep hanging glaciers were included in TPG1976 if they were identifiable on images in all three epochs (i.e. TPG1976, TPG2001, and TPG2013). The accuracy of manual digitization was controlled within one half-pixel. All glacier areas were calculated on the WGS84 spheroid in an Albers equal-area map projection centred at (95°E, 30°N) with standard parallels at 15°N and 65°N. Our results showed that the relative deviation of manual interpretation was less than 6.4% due to the 60 m spatial resolution images.
metadata.descriptionCn:
本数据集是1976年青藏高原冰川数据，使用了205景Landsat MSS/TM卫星多光谱遥感数据，其中189景（覆盖青藏高原研究区92%）在1972-79年，而116景为1976/77年。但藏东南地区由于云、雪的影响，高质量MSS数据不能获得，因此，藏东南部分区域通过逐年筛选，使用了所能获得最早的高质量Landsat TM数据，包括14景1980s（1981,1986-89,覆盖青藏高原研究区6.5%）和2景1994年数据（覆盖青藏高原研究区1.5%）。所用遥感数据，77%为冬季数据；61%为1976/1977年Landsat MSS/TM影像数据，因此，1976年为本数据集代表年份。本数据集冰川数据是青藏高原净冰川覆盖范围，不包括表碛覆盖部分。数据格式是TIFF，可以为青藏高原冰川变化、冰川水文研究提供基础数据支持。
数据内容：冰川编号FID_smglac，基于Albers等积圆锥投影计算的冰川面积area_km2，所在流域在我国冰川编目中冰川流域的二级编码code, 所在流域在我国冰川编目中冰川流域一级编码First_code,所在流域中文名称name，所在流域英文名称Ename,冰川斑块周长Peremeter(km)，斑块中心点X坐标（decimal degree）, 斑块中心点Y坐标（decimal degree）。
数据的投影方式：Albers等积圆锥投影。
格网单元：30m
数据加工方法：基于205/16景Landsat MSS/TM卫星数据，校正、镶嵌为假彩色合成影像（MSS, RGB:321；TM, RGB:543），采用人工目视解译方法，参考不同波段比值法结果，结合SRTM DEM V4.1数据与Google Earth 同一年不同季节的影像，剔除了山体阴影、季节性积雪的影响，参考我国第一期和第二期冰川编目数据，剔除了非冰川区陡崖、裸露基岩等，综合提取净冰川专题矢量数据，不包括冰川末端位置不清的表碛物覆盖区域，冰川边界数字化精度为半个像元（30m）。通过对比分析，可知基于多数据源、参考多方法结果、综合专家经验知识人-机互动方法获得的数据更准确。具体数据提取方法详见参考文献:
Ye, Q., J.Zong,L.Tian et al. (2017). Glacier changes on the Tibetan Plateau derived from Landsat imagery: mid-1970s – 2000 – 2013. Journal of Glaciology,63(238), 273-87. DOI:10.1017/jog.2016.137
原始遥感资料数据精度：60m。
数据质量控制措施：冰川边界数字化精度控制在半个像元之内（30m）。
加工后数据精度：通过分析典型区数据，最大误差为4%。TPG1976总体数据误差为6.4%。
项目来源：中国科学院战略性先导科技专项（A类）（XDA19070302），第二次青藏高原综合科学考察研究资助（2019QZKK0202），中国科学院“十三五”信息化建设专项资助(XXH13505-06)， 国家自然科学基金项目（41530748, 91747201）。

background: Nearly all mountain glaciers have been melting rapidly in recent decades (Gardner and others, 2013; Zemp and others, 2015) and this has been documented, especially in High Mountain Asia (HMA hereafter), in surveys of the whole (Li and others, 2008; Cogley, 2016) or large parts (Bolch and others, 2012; Yao and others, 2012) of the region as well as in basin-scale and single-glacier studies (Fujita and Nuimura, 2011; Wang and others, 2013; Yang and others, 2013). As reported in these earlier studies, most HMA glaciers showed obvious shrinkage (area loss) and thinning (implying mass loss) except in the west, for example in the Karakoram (Gardelle and others, 2012) and western Kunlun (Neckel and others, 2014; Kääb and others, 2015; Ke and others, 2015). However, due to strong spatiotemporal differences of climate variability and topographic effects, the magnitudes of glacier shrinkage have varied in space and time. The TP, defined by outlines from Zhang and others (2014), can be divided into two categories of hydrological unit, the outlines and basin codes of which we take from Shi and others (2008). Generally, meltwater from glaciers in IB flows into inland depressions, while those in EC flow into the ocean and so contribute more directly to sea-level rise. Climatically, the Indian monsoon dominates in the southeastern TP in summer (e.g. in 5O, 5N, 5L), with some effects from the East Asian monsoon in the east (e.g. in 5Y4, 5J, 5K). The westerlies are dominant in winter, especially in the western TP (e.g. 5Y6, 5Z4, 5Z3). Regions in the interior TP, such as 5Z1, 5Z2, 5Z5, 5Z6 and 5Y5 are less influenced both by the summer monsoon and the westerlies (Yao and others, 2012).
research objective: In this study, we present debris-free glacier area changes and their spatial heterogeneity at the plateau scale from the 1970s to 2013 based on three mosaic Landsat images, i.e. in the 1970s (TPG1970s), TPG2001 and TPG2013. Another purpose of the study is to enrich the available collection of glacier inventories in HMA, by presenting a detailed comparison of TPG datasets with previous glacier inventories.
challenges: We were unable to remove debris-covered areas from the GAMDAM inventory (GGI) (Nuimura and others, 2015), which includes debris cover but does not distinguish it from debris-free ice. Obviously snow and clouds could have affected glacier delineation, especially in southeastern Tibet where cloudy days are rather frequent in every season. Nor is it likely that the area differences are due to different treatment of debris cover, which is omitted in TGP2001 and included in GAMDAM.
methods: Glacier outlines (TPG1976, TPG2001 and TPG2013) were digitized manually with guidance from the SRTM DEM v4.1 and Google Earth imagery. To achieve complete multi-temporal coverage in a reasonable time, only debris-free ice was delineated. Time series of Landsat scenes were processed with Standard Terrain Correction (Level 1T), which provided systematic radiometric and geometric accuracy by incorporating ground control points while employing SRTM DEM for topographic accuracy. High-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage were selected for the delineation of glaciers. Glacier outlines were digitized on-screen manually from the three image mosaics, relying on false-colour image composites (MSS: red, green and blue (RGB) represented by bands 321; TM/ETM+: RGB by bands 543, OLI: RGB by bands 654), which allowed us to distinguish ice and snow from cloud. The manual delineation was carried out by three operators over a period of 6 years. The delineated glacier outlines were validated and edited by different operators at least three times by overlaying them onto Google Earth imagery, DEMs, topographic maps and corresponding satellite images by another two glacier researchers with field survey experience.
dataset: Glacier area on the plateau decreased from 44 366 ± 2827 km2 (1.7% of the study area) in the 1970s to 42 210 ± 1621 km2 in 2001 and 41 137 ± 1616 km2 in 2013.
findings: The comparative analysis of three mosaics shows that glacier area loss across the entire Tibetan Plateau is unequivocal. The glaciers in the M1970-76 subset showed shrinkage at−0.19% a−1 during 1976– 2001 and −0.20% a−1 during 2001– 13. Glaciers in the M1970-88 subset shrank at −0.34% a−1 during 1988 – 2013, and in the M1970-94 subset at −0.42% a−1 during 1994– 2013. The most dramatic glacier shrinkage occurred in the Mekong basin (region 5L) in the southeast, with change rates for M1970s-76 glaciers of −0.43% a−1 during 1976 – 2013 (−0.31% a−1 during 1976– 2001 and −0.73% a−1 during 2001– 13). Glaciers in the western and northern Tibetan Plateau changed at the slowest rates: −0.12% a−1 in 5Y6, −0.14% a−1 in 5Z1, −0.17% a−1 in 5Y5 and −0.17% a−1 in 5Z5 from 1976 to 2013. Overall, glaciers in externally drained catchments showed more dramatic shrinkage than those in the internally drained catchments. This shows a spatial gradient across the plateau of glacier shrinkage rate, decreasing from the southeast to the north and the west.
backgroundCn: 几乎所有的山地冰川在近几十年中都在快速融化（Gardner 等，2013；Zemp 等，2015），这一现象在高山亚洲（以下简称 HMA）得到了特别的记录，包括对整个地区（Li 等，2008；Cogley，2016）或大部分地区（Bolch 等，2012；Yao 等，2012）的调查，以及流域规模和单个冰川的研究（Fujita 和 Nuimura，2011；Wang 等，2013；Yang 等，2013）。正如这些早期研究所报告的，大多数 HMA 冰川显示出明显的缩小（面积损失）和变薄（意味着质量损失），但在西部地区，例如喀喇昆仑山（Gardelle 等，2012）和西昆仑山（Neckel 等，2014；Kääb 等，2015；Ke 等，2015）则有所不同。然而，由于气候变异和地形效应的强烈时空差异，冰川缩小的幅度在空间和时间上有所不同。根据 Zhang 等（2014）的轮廓，青藏高原（TP）可以分为两类水文单元，其轮廓和流域代码取自 Shi 等（2008）。一般来说，内陆冰川的融水流入内陆洼地，而东部冰川的融水则流入海洋，因此更直接地贡献于海平面上升。在气候上，印度季风在东南 TP 的夏季占主导地位（例如在 5O、5N、5L），而东亚季风在东部（例如在 5Y4、5J、5K）也有一些影响。西风在冬季占主导地位，尤其是在西部 TP（例如 5Y6、5Z4、5Z3）。青藏高原内部的地区，如 5Z1、5Z2、5Z5、5Z6 和 5Y5，受到夏季季风和西风的影响较小（Yao 等，2012）。
research objectiveCn: 在本研究中，我们基于三幅马赛克的Landsat影像（即1970年代的TPG1970s、TPG2001和TPG2013），呈现了1970年代至2013年间无碎屑冰川面积变化及其在高原尺度上的空间异质性。研究的另一个目的是通过对TPG数据集与之前的冰川清单进行详细比较，丰富喜马拉雅地区现有的冰川清单。
challengesCn: 我们无法从GAMDAM库存（GGI）（Nuimura等，2015）中去除覆盖碎屑的区域，该库存包括碎屑覆盖但未将其与无碎屑冰区区分开来。显然，雪和云层可能影响冰川的划界，尤其是在西南藏区，那里在每个季节多云的日子相对频繁。此外，区域差异不太可能是由于对碎屑覆盖的不同处理造成的，因为TGP2001中省略了碎屑覆盖，而GAMDAM中则包含了碎屑覆盖。
methodsCn: 冰川轮廓（TPG1976、TPG2001 和 TPG2013）是通过手动数字化的，参考了 SRTM DEM v4.1 和 Google Earth 图像。为了在合理的时间内实现完整的多时相覆盖，仅对无碎石的冰体进行了划定。对 Landsat 场景的时间序列进行了标准地形校正（Level 1T）处理，这通过结合地面控制点提供了系统的辐射和几何精度，同时采用 SRTM DEM 以确保地形精度。选择了高质量、云层和雪覆盖最少的图像用于冰川的划定。冰川轮廓是通过手动在三个图像马赛克上进行数字化的，依赖于假彩色图像合成（MSS：红、绿和蓝（RGB）由波段 321 表示；TM/ETM+：RGB 由波段 543 表示；OLI：RGB 由波段 654 表示），这使我们能够区分冰雪与云层。手动划定工作由三名操作员在六年内进行。划定的冰川轮廓经过不同操作员至少三次验证和编辑，方法是将其叠加到 Google Earth 图像、DEM、地形图和相应的卫星图像上，由另外两名具有实地调查经验的冰川研究人员进行审核。
datasetCn: 该高原上的冰川面积从1970年代的44,366 ± 2,827平方公里（占研究区域的1.7%）减少到2001年的42,210 ± 1,621平方公里，以及2013年的41,137 ± 1,616平方公里。
findingsCn: 三幅马赛克的比较分析表明，整个青藏 Plateau 的冰川面积损失是明确无疑的。在 M1970-76 子集中的冰川在 1976-2001 年间的收缩率为 -0.19% a−1，在 2001-2013 年间为 -0.20% a−1。M1970-88 子集中的冰川在 1988-2013 年间的收缩率为 -0.34% a−1，而 M1970-94 子集在 1994-2013 年间的收缩率为 -0.42% a−1。最显著的冰川收缩发生在东南部的湄公河流域（区域 5L），M1970s-76 冰川在 1976-2013 年间的变化率为 -0.43% a−1（1976-2001 年间为 -0.31% a−1，2001-2013 年间为 -0.73% a−1）。青藏 Plateau 西部和北部的冰川变化速率最慢：在 1976-2013 年间，5Y6 为 -0.12% a−1，5Z1 为 -0.14% a−1，5Y5 为 -0.17% a−1，5Z5 为 -0.17% a−1。总体而言，外部排水流域的冰川收缩比内部排水流域的冰川更为显著。这显示了冰川收缩速率在青藏 Plateau 上的空间梯度，从东南部向北部和西部递减。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are manual digitization techniques employed in data collection methods for glacier delineation on the Tibetan Plateau?
Verification.QuestionCn: 在对青藏高原的冰川划界数据收集方法中，是否采用手动数字化技术？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are manual digitization methods, automated algorithms, or a combination of both more effective for delineating glacier outlines on the Tibetan Plateau?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 手动数字化方法、自动算法，还是两者结合在青藏高原上划定冰川轮廓更有效？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is cloud cover, snow coverage, or debris cover the most significant challenge in delineating glaciers using Landsat imagery?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 云层覆盖、雪覆盖或碎屑覆盖在使用Landsat影像划定冰川时，哪个是最显著的挑战？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Does glacier data collection on the Tibetan Plateau primarily rely on Landsat imagery, SRTM DEM, or Google Earth imagery?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 青藏 Plateau 的冰川数据收集主要依赖于 Landsat 图像、SRTM DEM 还是 Google Earth 图像？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What data processing methods are employed to ensure accuracy in glacier boundary delineation?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 为了确保冰川边界划定的准确性，采用了哪些数据处理方法？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Correcting and mosaicking Landsat MSS/TM satellite data
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 校正和镶嵌Landsat MSS/TM卫星数据

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Who conducts the manual digitization of glacier outlines, and how is the accuracy of these outlines validated?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 谁进行冰川轮廓的手动数字化，如何验证这些轮廓的准确性？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where do the challenges in glacier delineation typically occur due to environmental factors?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 冰川划界通常由于环境因素而面临的挑战主要发生在以下几个方面：

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced during glacier data collection in the Tibetan Plateau region?
Example.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原地区进行冰川数据收集时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A significant challenge in glacier data collection is the presence of cloud cover and seasonal snow, particularly in southeastern Tibet. This can impede the accurate delineation of glaciers in satellite imagery, requiring careful selection of high-quality images and sometimes relying on the earliest available data of sufficient quality.
Example.AnswerCn: 在冰川数据收集中，一个显著的挑战是云层覆盖和季节性雪，特别是在东南部的西藏。这会妨碍卫星影像中冰川的准确划分，因此需要仔细选择高质量的影像，有时还需要依赖于足够质量的最早可用数据。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you give an example of how data accuracy is controlled when digitizing glacier outlines from satellite imagery?
Example.QuestionCn: 可以给出一个例子，说明在从卫星影像中数字化冰川轮廓时如何控制数据准确性吗？
Example.AnswerEn: Data accuracy is controlled by ensuring the digitization of glacier boundaries is within half a pixel (30m) precision. The manual delineation process is validated by multiple operators using high-resolution Google Earth imagery and DEMs, ensuring congruence with topographic maps and field-verified satellite images. The final dataset aims for a comprehensive error margin of about 6.4%, with maximum errors analyzed and controlled in typical areas.
Example.AnswerCn: 数据准确性通过确保冰川边界的数字化精度在半个像素（30米）以内来控制。手动划定过程通过多名操作员使用高分辨率的谷歌地球影像和数字高程模型（DEMs）进行验证，确保与地形图和经过实地验证的卫星图像的一致性。最终数据集的目标是实现约6.4%的全面误差范围，最大误差在典型区域内进行分析和控制。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of glacier area delineation methods using remote sensing data?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 冰川区域划定方法使用遥感数据的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: manual digitization, guided by SRTM DEM and Google Earth imagery, false-color image composites from Landsat scenes, high-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage, systematic radiometric and geometric correction, validated by overlaying onto various imagery and DEMs, checked by multiple operators for precision
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 手动数字化，以SRTM DEM和Google Earth影像为指导，使用Landsat场景的假彩色图像合成，选择云和雪覆盖最少的高质量图像，进行系统的辐射和几何校正，通过叠加到各种影像和DEM上进行验证，由多名操作员检查以确保精度。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the spatial heterogeneity observed in glacier area changes?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 导致冰川面积变化空间异质性的因素有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: climate variability, topographic effects, hydrological units, influence of Indian and East Asian monsoons, westerlies
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 气候变率、地形效应、水文单元、印度季风和东亚季风的影响、西风带。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What percentage of the Tibetan Plateau glacier dataset's area is covered by Landsat MSS/TM imagery from the year 1976?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 1976年，西藏高原冰川数据集的面积中有多少百分比被Landsat MSS/TM影像覆盖？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the maximum error percentage in processed glacier data for the Tibetan Plateau dataset?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 西藏高原数据集中处理过的冰川数据的最大误差百分比是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'manual digitization' mean in the context of glacier data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在冰川数据收集的背景下，“手动数字化”指的是通过人工方式将传统的纸质数据或图像转换为数字格式的过程。这通常涉及到对地图、图表或其他非数字化数据进行测量和记录，以便在计算机系统中进行分析和存储。
Definition.AnswerEn: Manual digitization in glacier data collection refers to the process where glacier outlines are digitized on-screen manually from image mosaics. This is done by operators who rely on false-colour image composites to distinguish ice and snow from clouds, ensuring accurate delineation of debris-free glacier areas.
Definition.AnswerCn: 冰川数据收集中的手动数字化是指操作人员在图像马赛克上手动数字化冰川轮廓的过程。操作人员依赖假彩色图像合成来区分冰雪与云层，从而确保准确划定无碎石的冰川区域。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used in extracting glacier outlines from Landsat imagery compare to traditional field-based survey methods in terms of precision and challenges?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 从Landsat影像提取冰川轮廓的数据收集方法与传统的基于实地调查的方法在精确度和挑战方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection methods using Landsat imagery involve manual digitization with guidance from SRTM DEM and Google Earth imagery, ensuring systematic radiometric and geometric accuracy. Challenges include removing debris-covered areas and dealing with cloud and snow coverage. This method offers a broad spatial and temporal coverage, unlike traditional field-based surveys which might provide higher precision locally but lack the expansive coverage and face practical challenges in remote areas like the Tibetan Plateau.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 使用Landsat影像的数据收集方法涉及手动数字化，并辅以SRTM数字高程模型和谷歌地球影像的指导，以确保系统的辐射和几何精度。挑战包括去除覆盖碎片的区域以及处理云层和雪覆盖。这种方法提供了广泛的空间和时间覆盖，与传统的基于实地的调查相比，后者可能在局部提供更高的精度，但缺乏广泛的覆盖，并在像青藏高原这样的偏远地区面临实际挑战。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences and similarities in the processing techniques of satellite imagery for glacier analysis between the 1970s and the more recent datasets?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在冰川分析中，1970年代和更近期数据集的卫星影像处理技术之间的差异和相似之处是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The processing of satellite imagery for glacier analysis in the 1970s involved the use of Landsat MSS/TM data corrected and mosaicked into false-color composites, with manual interpretation facilitated by SRTM DEM and Google Earth imagery. Recent datasets likely continue to use advanced processing techniques like Standard Terrain Correction and multi-temporal image mosaics, maintaining the fundamental approach of manual digitization but potentially benefiting from improved image resolutions and processing technologies.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在1970年代，冰川分析的卫星影像处理涉及使用Landsat MSS/TM数据进行校正和拼接成假彩色合成图，手动解译则借助SRTM DEM和Google Earth影像。最近的数据集可能继续使用先进的处理技术，如标准地形校正和多时相影像拼接，保持手动数字化的基本方法，但可能受益于更高的影像分辨率和处理技术的改进。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can the patterns of glacier shrinkage across different regions tell us about the influence of local climatic conditions on glacier dynamics?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 不同地区冰川缩小的模式可以告诉我们当地气候条件对冰川动态的影响。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The patterns of glacier shrinkage reveal that there are strong spatiotemporal differences influenced by local climatic conditions. For instance, glaciers in the southeastern Tibetan Plateau, dominated by the Indian monsoon, show more dramatic shrinkage compared to other regions. This indicates that local climate factors, like monsoons, significantly impact glacier dynamics and cause variations in shrinkage rates across the plateau.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 冰川缩小的模式显示出强烈的时空差异，这受到当地气候条件的影响。例如，受印度季风主导的东南藏高地区的冰川缩小更为显著，与其他地区相比。这表明当地气候因素，如季风，显著影响冰川动态，并导致高原各地的缩小速率存在差异。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise from using Landsat imagery for glacier delineation, and how can these be mitigated in data collection?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用Landsat影像进行冰川划界可能会面临哪些挑战，以及在数据收集过程中如何减轻这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using Landsat imagery for glacier delineation include the presence of snow and clouds, which can obscure glacier boundaries, particularly in frequently cloudy areas like southeastern Tibet. To mitigate these challenges, high-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage are selected, and the use of false-color composites aids in distinguishing ice from clouds. Additionally, the integration of other data sources, such as SRTM DEM and Google Earth, helps in refining the glacier delineation process.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用Landsat影像进行冰川划界的挑战包括雪和云的存在，这可能会遮挡冰川边界，特别是在像西南藏区这样经常多云的地区。为了减轻这些挑战，选择高质量的图像，尽量减少云和雪的覆盖，并且使用假彩色合成图有助于区分冰和云。此外，整合其他数据源，如SRTM数字高程模型和谷歌地球，有助于完善冰川划界过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in distinguishing debris-free ice from debris-covered areas in glacier datasets, and how might these challenges impact data accuracy?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在冰川数据集中，区分无碎片冰和有碎片区域的挑战主要由以下几个因素造成：冰川表面的光谱特征相似性、碎片的大小和分布不均、光照条件的变化、以及数据采集技术的限制。这些挑战可能会影响数据的准确性，导致对冰川变化、融化速率和水资源管理的评估出现偏差。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in distinguishing debris-free ice from debris-covered areas can arise from snow and cloud cover, especially in regions like southeastern Tibet where cloudy days are frequent. These conditions may affect glacier delineation accuracy, as debris-covered areas are not clearly differentiated in some inventories, potentially leading to discrepancies in glacier area measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在像西南藏这样的地区，频繁的云层和雪覆盖可能会导致区分无碎屑冰和碎屑覆盖区域的挑战。这些条件可能会影响冰川划界的准确性，因为在一些清单中，碎屑覆盖区域并未被清晰区分，这可能导致冰川面积测量的差异。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why might there be discrepancies in glacier boundary digitalization accuracy, and what factors contribute to these potential errors?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 冰川边界数字化准确性可能存在差异的原因是什么？哪些因素会导致这些潜在的错误？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Discrepancies in glacier boundary digitalization accuracy might result from the manual delineation process, which is subject to human interpretation and may vary between operators. Factors such as image quality, cloud cover, seasonal snow, and the presence of non-glacial features like bare rocks can contribute to these potential errors, despite using high-quality images and multiple validation steps.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 冰川边界数字化准确性中的差异可能源于手动划定过程，该过程受人类解释的影响，并且可能因操作员之间的差异而有所不同。图像质量、云层覆盖、季节性雪以及裸岩等非冰川特征的存在等因素可能会导致这些潜在错误，尽管使用了高质量的图像和多个验证步骤。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects on data accuracy when manually digitizing glacier outlines using various remote sensing data sources?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 手动数字化冰川轮廓时，使用各种遥感数据源可能对数据准确性产生的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Manual digitization of glacier outlines using various remote sensing data sources can lead to higher data accuracy due to the combination of different datasets, expert knowledge, and multi-method approaches. However, challenges such as cloud cover and debris-covered areas may still affect the delineation process, particularly in regions like southeastern Tibet with frequent cloudy conditions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 手动数字化冰川轮廓使用各种遥感数据源可以提高数据的准确性，因为结合了不同的数据集、专家知识和多方法的应用。然而，云层覆盖和碎石覆盖区域等挑战仍可能影响划定过程，特别是在像东南藏区这样频繁出现云层的地区。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How could the inclusion or exclusion of debris-covered glacier areas affect the outcomes of glacier inventory datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 包含或排除覆盖碎石的冰川区域如何影响冰川清单数据集的结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Excluding debris-covered glacier areas from datasets can result in more precise measurements of debris-free glacier areas, as debris can obscure glacier boundaries. However, this may also lead to discrepancies when comparing datasets that include debris-covered areas, as seen with the GAMDAM inventory, potentially affecting overall assessments of glacier area changes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 排除覆盖碎石的冰川区域的数据集可以更精确地测量无碎石冰川区域，因为碎石可能会遮挡冰川边界。然而，这也可能导致在比较包含覆盖碎石区域的数据集时出现差异，例如在GAMDAM清单中，这可能会影响对冰川面积变化的整体评估。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary goals of collecting glacier data using Landsat imagery on the Tibetan Plateau from the 1970s to 2013?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用Landsat影像收集1970年代至2013年间的青藏高原冰川数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goals are to present debris-free glacier area changes and their spatial heterogeneity at the plateau scale over multiple decades and to enhance the available collection of glacier inventories in High Mountain Asia by providing detailed comparisons with previous glacier inventories.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是展示多个十年间无碎屑冰川区域的变化及其在高原尺度上的空间异质性，并通过与之前的冰川清单进行详细比较，增强高山亚洲现有冰川清单的收集。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are necessary to ensure accurate delineation of glacier outlines using Landsat imagery?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保使用Landsat影像准确划定冰川轮廓所需的程序步骤包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Glacier outlines are digitized manually with guidance from the SRTM DEM v4.1 and Google Earth imagery. High-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage are selected for delineation. False-color image composites are used to distinguish ice and snow from clouds. Manual delineation is carried out by multiple operators, and outlines are validated and edited by overlaying them onto various imagery and maps, ensuring accuracy through multiple reviews.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 冰川轮廓是通过参考SRTM DEM v4.1和谷歌地球影像手动数字化的。选择高质量、云层和雪覆盖最少的影像进行划定。使用假彩色影像合成来区分冰雪与云层。多个操作员进行手动划定，并通过将轮廓叠加到各种影像和地图上进行验证和编辑，确保通过多次审查来保证准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What challenges are commonly encountered in removing debris-covered areas in glacier datasets, and how can these be addressed procedurally?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在冰川数据集中，去除覆盖碎片区域时常遇到的挑战有哪些，以及如何在程序上解决这些问题？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges in removing debris-covered areas include the inability to distinguish debris cover from debris-free ice in some inventories. Procedurally, these challenges can be addressed by using false-color composites to differentiate between ice and debris, employing DEM data for topographic accuracy, and manually digitizing outlines to exclude debris-covered areas. Consistent validation and cross-referencing with multiple data sources can help mitigate these challenges.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 去除覆盖碎屑区域的挑战包括在某些清单中无法区分碎屑覆盖的冰和无碎屑的冰。从程序上讲，这些挑战可以通过使用假彩色合成图来区分冰和碎屑，利用数字高程模型（DEM）数据提高地形精度，以及手动数字化轮廓以排除覆盖碎屑的区域来解决。持续的验证和与多个数据源的交叉参考可以帮助减轻这些挑战。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the extraction of accurate glacier boundaries in high-altitude regions using satellite imagery?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法可以利用卫星影像在高海拔地区提取准确的冰川边界？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The extraction of accurate glacier boundaries can be enabled by using methods such as manual digitization of glacier outlines from high-quality Landsat satellite imagery, which involves using false-color image composites and guidance from SRTM DEM and Google Earth imagery. This approach includes multi-operator validation and editing to ensure precision, and it accounts for systematic radiometric and geometric accuracy by incorporating ground control points.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 准确冰川边界的提取可以通过使用高质量的Landsat卫星影像手动数字化冰川轮廓的方法来实现，这涉及使用假彩色图像合成以及SRTM数字高程模型和谷歌地球影像的指导。该方法包括多操作员验证和编辑，以确保精确性，并通过纳入地面控制点来考虑系统的辐射和几何精度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or technologies enable the reduction of errors in glacier area measurement from satellite data?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或技术可以减少卫星数据中冰川面积测量的误差？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The reduction of errors in glacier area measurement from satellite data is enabled by employing high-resolution imagery, manual delineation with expert validation, and using a combination of data sources such as different Landsat images and DEMs. By ensuring that the digitization precision is controlled within half a pixel (30m), and by utilizing methods to eliminate the effects of clouds, snow, and non-glacier areas, the accuracy of the measurements is significantly improved.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过采用高分辨率影像、专家验证的手动划定以及使用不同的Landsat影像和数字高程模型（DEMs）等多种数据源，卫星数据中冰川面积测量的误差得到了减少。通过确保数字化精度控制在半个像素（30米）以内，并利用方法消除云层、雪和非冰川区域的影响，测量的准确性得到了显著提高。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the integration of multiple data sources and expert knowledge be expected to produce more accurate glacier data, despite potential methodological complexities?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 整合多个数据源和专家知识可能会产生更准确的冰川数据，尽管可能存在方法上的复杂性，这是因为不同的数据源可以提供互补的信息，帮助填补单一数据源的不足。同时，专家知识可以为数据解释和分析提供上下文，增强结果的可靠性和有效性。通过综合多种信息，可以更全面地理解冰川的动态变化，从而提高数据的准确性。
Expectation.AnswerEn: By integrating multiple data sources such as SRTM DEM and Google Earth imagery, along with expert knowledge and manual interpretation, researchers can cross-validate and refine glacier boundaries, reducing errors from a single data source or method. This comprehensive approach allows for the correction of potential inaccuracies and the consideration of local topographic effects, leading to more reliable glacier data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 通过整合多个数据源，如SRTM数字高程模型（DEM）和谷歌地球影像，以及专家知识和手动解读，研究人员可以交叉验证和修正冰川边界，从而减少单一数据源或方法带来的错误。这种综合方法允许纠正潜在的不准确性，并考虑局部地形效应，从而获得更可靠的冰川数据。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the implications of the reported 6.4% overall data error on research into glacier changes on the Tibetan Plateau?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在我看来，报告的6.4%整体数据误差对对青藏高原冰川变化的研究有何影响？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The reported 6.4% overall data error implies that while the dataset provides a reliable basis for understanding glacier changes on the Tibetan Plateau, there is room for improvement in data precision. This error margin highlights the potential influence of data inaccuracies on the findings and suggests that future research could benefit from enhanced methodologies or datasets that further reduce uncertainty, potentially through more advanced sensors or improved processing techniques.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 报告的6.4%整体数据误差意味着，尽管该数据集为理解青藏高原的冰川变化提供了可靠的基础，但在数据精度上仍有改进的空间。这个误差范围突显了数据不准确性对研究结果的潜在影响，并建议未来的研究可以通过更先进的传感器或改进的处理技术来进一步减少不确定性，从而受益于增强的方法或数据集。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection techniques can accurately differentiate between ice and debris-covered areas in glacier datasets.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集技术如何能够准确区分冰层和碎屑覆盖区域在冰川数据集中的差异。
Assertion.AnswerEn: To achieve accurate differentiation, the data collection method involves manual digitization of glacier outlines with guidance from SRTM DEM v4.1 and Google Earth imagery. High-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage are selected, and false-color image composites are used to distinguish ice from debris-covered areas.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了实现准确的差异化，数据收集方法涉及在SRTM DEM v4.1和谷歌地球影像的指导下手动数字化冰川轮廓。选择高质量的图像，确保云层和雪覆盖最小，并使用假彩色图像合成来区分冰和覆盖碎石的区域。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced when delineating glacier boundaries using satellite imagery.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定使用卫星影像划定冰川边界时面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges include the inability to remove debris-covered areas from inventories like GAMDAM, as well as potential effects of snow and clouds on glacier delineation, particularly in regions with frequent cloudy days. These factors can complicate the accurate mapping of glacier boundaries.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括无法从像GAMDAM这样的库存中移除被碎片覆盖的区域，以及雪和云对冰川划界的潜在影响，特别是在多云天气频繁的地区。这些因素可能会使冰川边界的准确绘制变得复杂。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data quality control measures ensure the precision of glacier boundary digitization.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据质量控制措施如何确保冰川边界数字化的精确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data quality control measures ensure precision by keeping the glacier boundary digitization accuracy within half a pixel (30m). The process involves manual validation, editing, and comparison with various data sources, including Google Earth imagery and topographic maps, to minimize errors.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制措施通过将冰川边界数字化精度保持在半个像素（30米）以内来确保精确性。该过程涉及手动验证、编辑以及与各种数据源（包括谷歌地球影像和地形图）的比较，以尽量减少错误。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data processing techniques used for extracting glacier outlines from Landsat MSS/TM satellite data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn:
提取冰川轮廓的Landsat MSS/TM卫星数据所使用的数据处理技术包括以下几个步骤：

1. **数据预处理**：包括辐射校正、几何校正和大气校正，以确保数据的准确性和一致性。
2. **图像增强**：使用对比度拉伸、直方图均衡等技术提高图像的可视性，突出冰川区域。
3. **阈值分割**：通过设置适当的阈值，将冰川区域与背景区分开，常用的方法包括Otsu法和自适应阈值。
4. **分类算法**：应用监督或无监督分类方法（如支持向量机、随机森林等）对图像进行分类，以识别冰川区域。
5. **后处理**：包括形态学操作（如开运算和闭运算）和噪声去除，以改善提取结果的质量。
6. **精度评估**：通过与实地调查数据或高分辨率影像进行比较，评估提取结果的准确性。

这些技术结合使用，可以有效提取出冰川的轮廓信息。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data processing techniques for extracting glacier outlines involve using Landsat MSS/TM satellite data to create false-color composite images (MSS, RGB:321; TM, RGB:543). Manual visual interpretation is employed, supported by various band ratio methods and combined with SRTM DEM V4.1 data and Google Earth imagery from different seasons of the same year. This process helps to eliminate the effects of mountain shadows and seasonal snow. Non-glacier areas such as steep cliffs and exposed bedrock are removed, and only net glacier vector data are extracted, excluding regions where the glacier terminus is unclear due to debris cover. The digitization precision of glacier boundaries is controlled within half a pixel (30m).
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 提取冰川轮廓的数据处理技术涉及使用Landsat MSS/TM卫星数据创建假彩色复合图像（MSS，RGB:321；TM，RGB:543）。采用手动视觉解译，并辅以各种波段比率方法，结合SRTM DEM V4.1数据和来自同一年不同季节的Google Earth影像。该过程有助于消除山影和季节性雪的影响。非冰川区域如陡峭悬崖和裸露基岩被去除，仅提取净冰川矢量数据，排除由于碎石覆盖而导致冰川末端不清晰的区域。冰川边界的数字化精度控制在半个像素（30米）以内。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss the challenges faced during the manual delineation of glacier outlines from satellite images and how these challenges are addressed.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请讨论从卫星图像手动划定冰川轮廓时面临的挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges during manual delineation of glacier outlines include the presence of snow and clouds, especially in southeastern Tibet, which can impede glacier delineation. To address these challenges, high-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage are selected for analysis. The manual delineation is conducted by multiple operators over several years, using false-color image composites for better ice and snow distinction. The delineated outlines undergo validation and editing at least three times by overlaying them onto Google Earth imagery, DEMs, topographic maps, and corresponding satellite images. This process involves additional glacier researchers with field survey experience to ensure accuracy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 手动划定冰川轮廓时面临的挑战包括雪和云的存在，尤其是在西南藏区，这可能会妨碍冰川的划定。为了解决这些挑战，选择高质量、云和雪覆盖较少的图像进行分析。手动划定由多个操作员在数年内进行，使用假彩色图像合成以更好地区分冰和雪。划定的轮廓至少经过三次验证和编辑，通过将其叠加到谷歌地球影像、数字高程模型（DEM）、地形图和相应的卫星图像上进行。这一过程涉及其他具有实地调查经验的冰川研究人员，以确保准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the potential sources or strategies to enhance the quality and accuracy of glacier inventory datasets in High Mountain Asia.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析提高高山亚洲冰川清单数据集质量和准确性的潜在来源或策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To enhance the quality and accuracy of glacier inventory datasets in High Mountain Asia, one strategy is to integrate multi-source data, such as high-resolution satellite imagery from different seasons, combined with topographic data like SRTM DEM. Employing a combination of automated and manual delineation methods could improve precision, especially in debris-covered areas. Utilizing a team of experts with field survey experience for validation, as well as employing advanced image processing algorithms to differentiate between ice, snow, and debris, can further refine the dataset. Continuous updates and comparisons with previous inventories could also help in tracking changes more accurately and addressing spatial and temporal variability challenges.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了提高高山亚洲冰川清单数据集的质量和准确性，一种策略是整合多源数据，例如来自不同季节的高分辨率卫星影像，结合像SRTM DEM这样的地形数据。采用自动化和手动划定方法的结合可以提高精度，特别是在覆盖碎石的区域。利用具有实地调查经验的专家团队进行验证，以及采用先进的图像处理算法来区分冰、雪和碎石，可以进一步完善数据集。持续更新和与之前的清单进行比较也有助于更准确地跟踪变化，并应对空间和时间变异性挑战。
